Rotorua retiree with terminal cancer seeks replacement for Ngongotahā community garden work https://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/rotorua-retiree-with-terminal-cancer-seeks-replacement-for-ngongotaha-community-garden-work/EEEHF72W7ZDVXKSPXC46HJQ5HI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/rotorua-retiree-with-terminal-cancer-seeks-replacement-for-ngongotaha-community-garden-work/EEEHF72W7ZDVXKSPXC46HJQ5HI/ Megan WilsonRetired Baptist minister says he's had a 'fabulous life'. Gisborne seeking exemption from Government’s freshwater plan change freeze https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-seeking-exemption-from-governments-freshwater-plan-change-freeze/STH6FVXEUJERLIUROAIOVQDUUI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-seeking-exemption-from-governments-freshwater-plan-change-freeze/STH6FVXEUJERLIUROAIOVQDUUI/ Zita Campbell, Local Democracy ReporterGisborne councillors oppose Wellington's rule change, seeking exemption. Tue, 03 Dec 2024 16:00:00 +0000 Image of the Mōtū River in December 2014. The Mōtū catchment plan's notifications for plan changes are being pushed back until 2026 following a recent government rule change on freshwater planning, prohibiting councils from notifying freshwater planning instruments. Photo / Liam Clayton
